Class Army

  • java.lang.Object
    • Army

  • public class Army
extends java.lang.Object
    The Army class represents an army with variable amounts of foot soldiers, tanks, and planes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Army(int numFootSoldiers, int numTanks, int numPlanes)
      Constructor.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getNumFootSoldiers() 
      int getNumPlanes() 
      int getNumTanks() 
      boolean isDefeated()
      Returns boolean that describes whether the army is defeated or not.
      void takeDamage(int footSoldiersDamage, int tanksDamage, int planesDamage)
      Deals damage to the army in terms of net loss for each unit.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Converts the Army object to String format by returning the amounts of each unit that the army has.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Army

        public Army(int numFootSoldiers,
    int numTanks,
    int numPlanes)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        numFootSoldiers - (required) The int number of foot soldiers in the army.
        numTanks - (required) The int number of tanks in the army.
        numPlanes - (required) The int number of planes in the army.

    • Method Detail

      • isDefeated

        public boolean isDefeated()
        Returns boolean that describes whether the army is defeated or not. This function assumes that an army is defeated only if it has 0 of each unit.
        Returns:
        true if the army is defeated

      • getNumFootSoldiers

        public int getNumFootSoldiers()
        Returns:
        current number of foot soldiers

      • getNumTanks

        public int getNumTanks()
        Returns:
        current number of tanks

      • getNumPlanes

        public int getNumPlanes()
        Returns:
        current number of planes

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage(int footSoldiersDamage,
              int tanksDamage,
              int planesDamage)
        Deals damage to the army in terms of net loss for each unit.
        Parameters:
        footSoldiersDamage - (required) The int number of foot soldiers the army loses.
        tanksDamage - (required) The int number of tanks the army loses.
        planesDamage - (required) The int number of planes the army loses.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Converts the Army object to String format by returning the amounts of each unit that the army has.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the String representation of the Battle object.
